page.title: 03Farming-Imberhorne Farm 2
page.content: The sizes of the fields have changed over the years. A farmer used to have a lot of small fields but now a farmer tends to have a few large fields so that the farm machinery can work more efficiently and turn round more easily. Mr. Emmett does not like using too many chemicals because it would be expensive and might ruin the crops or even the land. If you look in most fields on Imberhorne Farm you would see a ditch on either side. It is there because it helps to drain the fields. In part of the farm is a large private house called Gullege. It is thought that it was once one of Henry VIII's hunting lodges. By Georgina Wilkie, class visit Halsford Park School, 1985 .
